result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Rogelio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 22CF118.  Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute sobriety.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.

DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: fine in the amount of $200.00.  All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA. Any cash bond on deposit shall be applied to costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Rogelio

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Jesse Rogelio.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Case 22CF118, with credit for 2 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation. 

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $200.00; 
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
Any cash bond on deposit shall be applied to costs. 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court with attorney Jason A Findling in Branch 11.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 11 has accepted the case for global resolution.  Reserve Branch 13 allows for transfer of the case to Branch 11 for global resolution.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel was recently appointed and has received discovery and has not received an offer from the state.  
Defendant has a felony matter (22CF118) in Branch 11 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 11 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Home Depot
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

04:10 PM Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Jesse Rogelio in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesse Rogelio appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
